page.title: 16THE BAKERY - WICHENFORD
page.content: {Palmers' Bakery}has been in operation for{70 years,}with the present Mr. Palmer in control for 8 years. Bread is still baked in the{original {brick oven,}which was recently converted from brick to oil. Work begins at{4.30 am}with mixing the dough for about{200 loaves}and Chelsea buns and doughnuts. New flour stock is ordered each fortnight. During the day Mrs. Palmer sells bread in the shop while her husband and son deliver to shops in{Worcester, Martley and{Broadheath The Bakery is closed for lunch, but most of the trade is finished by then and they rarely have unsold loaves. The business is closed on Sundays and for{one week's holiday}a year. It is a well known, well liked bakery with regular customers coming from up to 10 miles for their day's bread.
